subject: Programming
title: Time Versus Space Tradeoffs
description: A quick win: understand Time Versus Space Tradeoffs.

hook.text: You can sort a deck of cards faster if you spread them across a huge table.

buildup.text: Algorithms often trade memory for speed. Using more space can dramatically cut processing time.

discovery.text: Hash tables use extra memory to achieve nearly instant lookups â€” O(1) instead of O(n).

twist.text: In low-memory environments, speed must be sacrificed. The tradeoff is never free.

climax.text: Great engineers don't pick the fastest algorithm. They pick the right tradeoff for the constraint.

punchline.text: Speed and memory are always in negotiation.

quiz.question: What do hash tables trade to achieve fast lookups?
